> Why is something like 
> assert foo != null : "Foo null";
> a bad thing?


if the condition if false, an AssertionError will be thrown.  Your 
method will then be exited immediatly.

If no class catches the error, your program will simply exit (and if you 
have written your code with 1.1, 1.2 or 1.3 it will be the case).  It is 
the right way to deal with a null argument?  I don't think so.

-Vladimir
